page.title: 10MEDIA :WASHINGTON/ GATESHEAD
page.content: This area has several libraries, the largest of which is {Gateshead {library }at {Caedmon Hall. }In addition to the 143,000 books, videos, records, cassettes and computer software can be borrowed. The library also has a{tourist information {centre,}talking books for the blind and a{computer shopping system. Other information services include local newspapers. The {Sunderland Echo was first circulated in 1893 and is delivered to 69,000 homes each night . Its sister paper {The Washington Echo, is distributed free to 95% of people in Washington. Most children in our area have {televisions,}some also have{videos. The most popular programmes were comedy, horror and soap operas. Most people have colour televisions, some also have portables.
